essential.label: Essential (Tooling)
essential.description: Build strategy-agnostic tooling that makes all options configurable.
guidance: This is foundational work. Build it well, document it thoroughly.
Focus on flexibility — support multiple strategies without rebuilding.
This enables everything else. Don't cut corners here.
Other teams and clients will depend on this being solid.
essential.investmentLogic: Must build — feature doesn't function without it

enhanced.label: Enhanced (Platform Spikes)
enhanced.description: Understand technologies, build platform knowledge. Learn once, advise all clients.
guidance: This builds platform intelligence. Time-box it, document findings.
The goal is understanding that transfers to future work.
Create artifacts: comparison docs, decision matrices, best practices.
Even if we don't ship a feature, the learning is valuable.
enhanced.investmentLogic: Should build — multiplies value across clients

specialized.label: Specialized (Context Spikes)
specialized.description: Industry and client-specific discovery. What works for fasteners may not work for cabinet hardware.
specialized.focus: Validate → Scope → Build (if validated) → Document edge cases
guidance: Validate before committing. Run a POC.
This is the riskiest category — highest chance of waste.
Get explicit sign-off before significant investment.
If it works, document heavily — it becomes industry IP.
specialized.investmentLogic: Might build — only if validated for this context

layer.label: Layer
layer.question: What TYPE of work is this?

options.label: Platform
options.description: Backend services, APIs, models, pipelines, data processing
options.examples: Embedding service, ES index, search API, product pipeline

options.label: Integration
options.description: Frontend components, UI wiring, client-facing touchpoints
options.examples: Upload UI, results display, camera capture, filters

options.label: Universal
options.description: Works for any client in any industry
options.examples: CLIP embedding, ES KNN, basic similarity

options.label: Industry-Specific
options.description: Works for any client in the SAME industry
options.reusability: Build for first client, becomes platform IP
options.examples: Thread pitch detection, fastener OCR, wood grain matching

options.label: Client-Specific
options.examples: Config values, UI wiring, custom workflows

options.label: Essential (Tooling)
options.description: Must exist for the feature to function at all
options.investment: Must build — feature doesn't function without it

options.label: Enhanced (Platform Spikes)
options.investment: Should build — multiplies value across clients

options.label: Specialized (Context Spikes)
options.description: Complex, requires POC/research, may not build
options.investment: Might build — only if validated for this context

universal-essential.label: Core infrastructure. This is foundational platform work.
universal-essential.reusability: Every client benefits. Build it right once.

universal-enhanced.label: Improves platform quality for all clients.

universal-specialized.label: High potential value but requires POC validation.

industry-essential.label: Market differentiator for this vertical.
industry-essential.billing: Shared: first client pays premium, future clients get discount
industry-essential.reusability: Becomes platform IP for this industry.

industry-enhanced.label: Valuable addition for industry clients.
industry-enhanced.billing: Partially billable to first client, platform for future
industry-enhanced.reusability: Industry knowledge that transfers to similar clients.

industry-specialized.label: Only build with clear demand and validation.
industry-specialized.reusability: Niche — may only help a few clients in vertical.

client-specialized.label: Why are we building specialized work for one client?
client-specialized.billing: Billable only if client insists and pays premium

platform.universal: Platform work with universal scope is the highest leverage. Invest in quality and documentation.
platform.industry: Platform work for an industry becomes IP. Ensure it's abstracted enough to reuse.
platform.client: Platform work for a single client is unusual. Consider if this should be integration instead.

integration.universal: Reusable UI components are valuable. Build with configuration in mind.
integration.industry: Industry-specific UI can be templatized. Look for patterns.
integration.client: Client integration work. Keep scope tight, don't over-engineer.
